article_title: Joni Eareckson Tada: The Disability Double Standard
article_text:
In the 23 years since the passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act, I have watched its most celebrated ideals crumble under a double standard. Apparently, when it comes to people with disabilities having a right to live the fullest life possible, some disabilities are more deserving than others.

I had the honor of serving on the National Council on Disability when the ADA became law. It was intended to guarantee the basic rights...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Joni Eareckson Tada writes that instead of helping the disabled live full lives, new laws seek to help them die.
twitter.title: The Disability Double Standard
